channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Top diplomats from Germany, Jordan and the UK call for an immediate ceasefire in Sudan war
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The foreign ministers of Germany, Jordan and the United Kingdom jointly called on Saturday for an immediate ceasefire in the war in Sudan, describing the situation there in stark, apocalyptic terms after a paramilitary force seized the last major city in the East A
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Tanzania President Hassan wins disputed election with more than 97% of vote, official results show
item.description: DODOMA, Tanzania (AP) — Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan won the country’s disputed election with more than 97% of the vote, according to official results announced early Saturday, in a rare landslide victory in the region.
item.dc:creator: RODNEY MUHUMUZA, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Wicker, Reed demand Hegseth share Caribbean strike orders
item.description: Sens. Jack Reed (D-R.I.) and Roger Wicker (R-Miss.) on Friday called on Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth to give them copies of the orders issued to strike boats in the Caribbean that the Trump administration says were trafficking drugs. They released two letters addressed to Hegseth.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Mancini, The Hill

item.title: Unidentified remains of 3 people transferred to Israel, Red Cross says
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Red Cross said it transferred the unidentified remains of three people to Israel late Friday but they were still being examined and may not be those of missing hostages, an Israeli military official said.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and JULIA FRANKEL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Protesters call for governor’s resignation after Rio’s deadliest police raid
item.description: Hundreds of protesters have marched through Vila Cruzeiro favela, demanding the resignation of Rio de Janeiro state Gov. Cláudio Castro.
item.dc:creator: Eléonore Hughes, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Andrew, the civilian formerly known as 'prince,' faces an uncertain future
item.description: LONDON (AP) — He has lost his title as prince, lost his rent-free mansion on the sprawling grounds next to Windsor Castle and lost whatever remained of his reputation in the public eye.
item.dc:creator: BRIAN MELLEY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Trump designates Nigeria as 'country of particular concern' over widespread Christian persecution, killings
item.description: Christian persecution in Nigeria has ramped up dramatically as Islamist militants burn villages and kill thousands of believers in targeted attacks across the country.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Israel's military prosecutor admits she leaked video of soldiers assaulting a Palestinian detainee
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israel’s top military prosecutor resigned Friday, admitting she was responsible for leaking a video showing soldiers assaulting a Palestinian detainee at a notorious military detention center, according to excerpts of the letter published by Israeli media.
item.dc:creator: JULIA FRANKEL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Militia attack on hospital in Darfur came in waves, WHO says
item.description: The World Health Organization reports that gunmen who reportedly killed at least 460 people at a hospital in Sudan's Darfur region returned three times to the facility during their assault.
item.dc:creator: Jamey Keaten And Sarah El Deeb, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Pakistan says it seeks no further escalation but urges Afghanistan to act against militants
item.description: ISLAMABAD (AP) — Pakistan does not seek further escalation of hostilities with Afghanistan but expects the South Asian country's Taliban rulers to address its security concerns by taking action against militants operating from Afghan soil, Pakistan’s Foreign Ministry said Friday.
item.dc:creator: MUNIR AHMED, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Prince Andrew moves to Sandringham
item.description: Unlike other properties that the royal family inhabits through the Crown Estate, Sandringham is privately owned by the king.
item.dc:creator: Teddy Grant, NewsNation

item.title: UN human rights chief calls on Pentagon to halt strikes on suspected drug boats
item.description: United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk called for the Pentagon to halt boat strikes against vessels suspected to be carrying drugs in order to prevent “extrajudicial killings.
item.dc:creator: Surina Venkat, The Hill

item.title: Built in the shadows and launched at night, Ukraine's long-range drones are rattling Russia
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — At a secret location in rural Ukraine, columns of attack drones are assembled at night and in near silence to strike deep inside Russia. Their targets are strategic: oil refineries, fuel depots, and military logistics hubs.
item.dc:creator: DEREK GATOPOULOS and VOLODYMYR YURCHUK, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Louvre heist highlights thorny issue for museums: How to secure art without becoming fortresses
item.description: The day after the jewelry heist at the Louvre in Paris, officials from across Washington's world-famous museums were already talking, assessing and planning how to bolster their own security.
item.dc:creator: R.J. RICO and JOCELYN NOVECK, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Ex-Mossad chief behind Iran nuclear warehouse raid says Iran’s atomic sites ‘obliterated,’ credits Trump
item.description: Former Mossad director reveals Iran's nuclear sites were "obliterated" in U.S. strikes, warns Tehran that Israel "can come again" if uranium enrichment resumes.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Security forces and protesters clash following disputed election in Tanzania; UN says 10 dead
item.description: Protests in Tanzania have entered their third day as the electoral body continues to announce the results of an election that sparked deadly demonstrations, leading to the government’s shutdown of the internet and the deployment of the military.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Over 100 killed in Brazil’s deadliest police raid as Rio authorities battle drug gangs in favelas
item.description: Brazil’s deadliest police raid left 132 dead in Rio de Janeiro as officers clashed with gangs using drones and explosives in the city’s favelas.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: US orders nonemergency personnel to leave Mali
item.description: The State Department ordered non-emergency employees to leave Mali as the government there comes under increasing pressure from al Qaeda-linked insurgents.
item.dc:creator: Daphne Psaledakis, NewsNation

item.title: Fate of thousands feared in Darfur after reported rampage by Sudanese paramilitary force
item.description: CAIRO (AP) — Sudanese fleeing a paramilitary force that seized a city in the country’s Darfur region trickled into a nearby refugee camp Thursday after walking for miles, telling aid workers that roads were littered with bodies.
item.dc:creator: SARAH EL DEEB and FARNOUSH AMIRI, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Prince Andrew dragged out negotiations before banishment for cash: Source
item.description: Asked if there was a “number” Andrew had in mind, the source said, “I think a couple of million would go a long way.
item.dc:creator: Paula Froelich, NewsNation

item.title: 5 more arrests as Louvre jewel heist probe deepens and key details emerge
item.description: PARIS (AP) — The dragnet tightened around the Louvre thieves on Thursday. Five more people were seized in the crown-jewels heist — including a suspect tied by DNA — the Paris prosecutor said, widening the sweep across the capital and its suburbs.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS ADAMSON and ANGELA CHARLTON, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Neck-and-neck finish in Dutch election as Wilders' far-right party and centrist D66 tie
item.description: THE HAGUE, Netherlands (AP) — Anti-Islam lawmaker Geert Wilders' far-right Party for Freedom and the centrist D66 were tied with nearly all votes counted Thursday in the Dutch general election in an unprecedented neck-and-neck race to become the biggest party.
item.dc:creator: MIKE CORDER and MOLLY QUELL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: 5 deals Trump, Xi struck in South Korea
item.description: President Trump emerged from his meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday touting agreements on tariffs, rare earth exports and soybean purchases as the two superpowers reached truces on key issues.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, The Hill

item.title: Red Cross receives two coffins of deceased hostages in Gaza Strip, IDF says
item.description: Israel said the Red Cross reported receiving "two coffins of deceased hostages" during a transfer in the Gaza Strip and is brining the remains to IDF troops.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Tariffs, trade and TikTok: Takeaways from Trump-Xi meeting
item.description: Trump said he and China’s Xi left the nearly two-hour meeting with newfound solidarity on a laundry list of issues.
item.dc:creator: Libbey Dean, NewsNation

item.title: Hegseth says military conducted another strike on boat carrying alleged narco-terrorists
item.description: The U.S. military targeted another alleged narco-trafficking boat, sparking congressional concerns over due process and legal authority for the deadly strikes.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Antisemitic attacker faced 30-year sentence, gets less than 1½ years in plea deal
item.description: Tarek Bazrouk, a 20-year-old Palestinian American, was sentenced to 17 months in prison for federal hate crimes after attacking Jewish protesters in New York City.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Frontlines with Robert Sherman: All eyes on China, US relationship
item.description: The two heads of state representing the two most powerful economies in the world are set to meet face-to-face within the next few hours.
item.dc:creator: Robert Sherman, NewsNation

item.title: Mexican president disagrees with US revoking 13 Mexican airline routes
item.description: Sheinbaum added she will meet with Mexican airlines on Friday to gain insight into their perspective on the matter.
item.dc:creator: Raul Cortes, Natalia Siniawski, Franklin Paul, NewsNation

item.title: Putin says Russia's nuclear-armed underwater drone was tested successfully
item.description: MOSCOW (AP) — Russia has conducted a successful test of a new atomic-powered and nuclear-capable underwater drone, President Vladimir Putin said Wednesday, declaring that the new weapon can't be intercepted.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: New Jersey man's Titanic belongings recovered expected to auction for more than $100K
item.description: Frederick Sutton's Titanic personal effects, including gold watch and first-class passenger list, remain in family hands for over a century before auction.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Amnesty says deadly US strike on Yemen prison may be a war crime
item.description: An American airstrike in April on a prison run by Yemen's Houthi rebels killed more than 60 detained African migrants.
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Trump visits South Korea as he attempts to secure billions in investment
item.description: President Trump met South Korean leader Lee Jae Myung in Gyeongju, discussing partnerships during the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Here's how tariffs could impact holiday shopping season: Analysis
item.description: If current tariffs had been in place last year, consumers would have faced a $28.6 billion burden, a new analysis finds.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Dorn, NewsNation

item.title: Man accused of stabbing teens with fork on international flight
item.description: Praneeth Kumar Usiripalli, 28, was charged with assault with a dangerous weapon with intent to cause bodily harm on an aircraft.
item.dc:creator: Sean Noone, NewsNation

item.title: At least 64 killed in Rio police raids ahead of climate conferences
item.description: Police have often conducted large-scale operations against criminal groups ahead of major events in Rio.
item.dc:creator: Rodrigo Viga Gaier / Reuters, NewsNation

item.title: Plane crashes while flying tourists to Kenya's Maasai Mara, killing 11 people
item.description: NAIROBI, Kenya (AP) — A plane crash killed 11 people, mostly foreign tourists, in Kenya’s coastal region of Kwale early Tuesday while they were en route to the Maasai Mara National Reserve in heavy rain.
item.dc:creator: EVELYNE MUSAMBI, Associated Press, NewsNation
